newsitem.title: USA: Nabisco intl sales rise, sees strong Q4.
newsitem.headline: Nabisco intl sales rise, sees strong Q4.

text.p: Nabisco Holdings Corp said Thursday it is expecting "a strong fourth quarter" after reporting third quarter operating earnings of $0.26 per share on total sales of $2.238 billion.
Nabisco said international sales rose 16 percent in the quarter to $660 million from $570 million last year, despite lower gross margins from higher commodity costs.
Third quarter domestic sales rose 7 percent to $1.58 billion from $1.47 billion a year-ago, fueled by sales of Oreo, Ritz and Chips Ahoy! products and the new Air Crisp line, the company said.
Nabisco said sales in its core products and savings from this year's restructuring of its domestic and international businesses should help fourth quarter results.

"Looking ahead, we see the momentum in our business continuing to strengthen," the company stated. "Our focus on highly profitable, core products, coupled with the anticipated cost savings from our restructuring, put us in an excellent position for a strong fourth quarter."
